#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=CHAPTER VI .
#Text=RED KERRY

#Text=Chief Inspector Kerry , of the Criminal Investigation Department , stood before the empty grate of his cheerless office in New Scotland Yard , one hand thrust into the pocket of his blue reefer jacket and the other twirling a malacca cane , which was heavily silver-mounted and which must have excited the envy of every sergeant-major beholding it .
#Text=Chief Inspector Kerry wore a very narrow-brimmed bowler hat , having two ventilation holes conspicuously placed immediately above the band .
#Text=He wore this hat tilted forward and to the right .
#Text=“ Red Kerry ” wholly merited his sobriquet , for the man was as red as fire .
#Text=His hair , which he wore cropped close as a pugilist 's , was brilliantly red , and so was his short , wiry , aggressive moustache .
#Text=His complexion was red , and from beneath his straight red eyebrows he surveyed the world with a pair of unblinking , intolerant steel-blue eyes .

#Text=He never smoked in public , as his taste inclined towards Irish twist and a short clay pipe ; but he was addicted to the use of chewing-gum , and as he chewed -- and he chewed incessantly -- he revealed a perfect row of large , white , and positively savage-looking teeth .
#Text=High cheek bones and prominent maxillary muscles enhanced the truculence indicated by his chin .

#Text=But , next to this truculence , which was the first and most alarming trait to intrude itself upon the observer 's attention , the outstanding characteristic of Chief Inspector Kerry was his compact neatness .
#Text=Of no more than medium height but with shoulders like an acrobat , he had slim , straight legs and the feet of a dancing master .
#Text=His attire , from the square-pointed collar down to the neat black brogues , was spotless .

#Text=His reefer jacket fitted him faultlessly , but his trousers were cut so unfashionably narrow that the protuberant thigh muscles and the line of a highly developed calf could quite easily be discerned .
#Text=The hand twirling the cane was small but also muscular , freckled and covered with light down .
#Text=Red Kerry was built on the lines of a whippet , but carried the equipment of an Irish terrier .
#Text=The telephone bell rang .
#Text=Inspector Kerry moved his square shoulders in a manner oddly suggestive of a wrestler , laid the malacca cane on the mantleshelf , and crossed to the table .
#Text=Taking up the telephone :
#Text=“ Yes ? ” he said , and his voice was high-pitched and imperious .
#Text=He listened for a moment .
#Text=“ Very good , sir . ”
#Text=He replaced the receiver , took up a wet oilskin overall from the back of a chair and the cane from the mantleshelf .
#Text=Then rolling chewing-gum from one corner of his mouth into the other , he snapped off the electric light and walked from the room .
#Text=Along the corridor he went with a lithe , silent step , moving from the hips and swinging his shoulders .
#Text=Before a door marked “ Private ” he paused .
#Text=From his waistcoat pocket he took a little silver convex mirror and surveyed himself critically therein .
#Text=He adjusted his neat tie , replaced the mirror , knocked at the door and entered the room of the Assistant Commissioner .
#Text=This important official was a man constructed on huge principles , a man of military bearing , having tired eyes and a bewildered manner .
#Text=He conveyed the impression that the collection of documents , books , telephones , and other paraphernalia bestrewing his table had reduced him to a state of stupor .
#Text=He looked up wearily and met the fierce gaze of the chief inspector with a glance almost apologetic .
#Text=“ Ah , Chief Inspector Kerry ? ” he said , with vague surprise .
#Text=“ Yes .
#Text=I told you to come .
#Text=Really , I ought to have been at home hours ago .
#Text=It 's most unfortunate .
#Text=I have to do the work of three men .
#Text=This is your department , is it not , Chief Inspector ? ”
#Text=He handed Kerry a slip of paper , at which the Chief Inspector stared fiercely .
#Text=“ Murder ! ” rapped Kerry .
#Text=“ Sir Lucien Pyne .
#Text=Yes , sir , I am still on duty . ”
#Text=His speech , in moments of interest , must have suggested to one overhearing him from an adjoining room , for instance , the operation of a telegraphic instrument .
#Text=He gave to every syllable the value of a rap and certain words he terminated with an audible snap of his teeth .
#Text=“ Ah , ” murmured the Assistant Commissioner .
#Text=“ Yes .
#Text=Divisional Inspector --
#Text=Somebody ( I cannot read the name ) has detained all the parties .
#Text=But you had better report at Vine Street .
#Text=It appears to be a big case . ”
#Text=He sighed wearily .
#Text=“ Very good , sir .
#Text=With your permission I will glance at Sir Lucien 's pedigree . ”
#Text=“ Certainly -- certainly , ” said the Assistant Commissioner , waving one large hand in the direction of a bookshelf .
#Text=Kerry crossed the room , laid his oilskin and cane upon a chair , and from the shelf where it reposed took a squat volume .
#Text=The Assistant Commissioner , hand pressed to brow , began to study a document which lay before him .
#Text=“ Here we are , ” said Kerry , sotto voce .
#Text=“ Pyne , Sir Lucien St. Aubyn , fourth baronet , son of General Sir Christian Pyne , K.C.B. H 'm !
#Text=Born Malta ... .
#Text=Oriel College ; first in classics ... .
#Text=H 'm .
#Text=Blue ... . India , Burma ... . Contested Wigan ... . attached British Legation . ... H 'm ! ... ”
#Text=He returned the book to its place , took up his overall and cane , and :
#Text=“ Very good , sir , ” he said .
#Text=“ I will proceed to Vine Street . ”
#Text=“ Certainly -- certainly , ” murmured the Assistant Commissioner , glancing up absently .
#Text=“ Good night . ”
#Text=“ Good night , sir . ”
#Text=“ Oh , Chief Inspector ! ”
#Text=Kerry turned , his hand on the door-knob .
#Text=“ Sir ? ”
#Text=“ I -- er -- what was I going to say ?
#Text=Oh , yes !
#Text=The social importance of the murdered man raises the case from the -- er -- you follow me ?
#Text=Public interest will become acute , no doubt .
#Text=I have therefore selected you for your well known discretion .
#Text=I met Sir Lucien once .
#Text=Very sad .
#Text=Good night . ”
